○ Reid Bars to Column Starter Cage
○ Reid Bars for hanging pile cage
○ Shop drawing and shop drawing check form to be provided to the Engineer for review.
QA Record - Shop Drawing Approval, Pile Cage inspection

Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - Before commencing pile drilling operations, survey set out pile position based on model. Set out to include; pile centre, height and offset.

Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - Pile casing to be installed into a shallow pre drilled hole. Pile casing to be as per submitted methodology and correspondence. Pile casing verticality to be checked using a spirit level.
Standard, Drawing or Specification Reference - C0602.5.6, C0602.5.7
Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - All welding of reinforcement shall be carried out in accordance with AS/NZS 1554.3.
○ The welding procedure shall be made available to the Engineer upon request.
○ All welds shall be category SP in accordance with AS/NZS 1554.3
○ 100% visual examination by independent welding inspector.
QA Record - Welder Qualification, Weld Procudure, NDE Report
Standard, Drawing or Specification Reference - 3235599-SP03-ST-3150-1 Note 3.9
Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - Depth to be checked and recorded after auger/excavation.
○ Diameter of pile shall not be less than the specified diameter.
QA Record - Survey Checks, Pile Card, Photos
Standard, Drawing or Specification Reference - 3235599-SP03-ST-3150-1 Note 2.3, 3.2, 3.8, C0500 A3.0.5

Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - Geotechnical Engineer to confirm top of rock during the pile boring operation. And to inspect the material at the base and side of the rock socket complies with the design requirements (Bearing) at least equal to or greater than that nominated on the drawings.
○ The pile card shall be signed by the inspecting Engineer confirming inspection has taken place and the founding stratum meets the relevant design requirements.
○ Tolerance on Top of Rock level variance of ±2m from anticipated level is acceptable.
QA Record - MSQ SVR Pile Card
Standard, Drawing or Specification Reference - C0500 A6.0.2 Table 2
Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - Geotechnical Engineer to inspection base cleanliness prior to reinforcing cage placement.
QA Record - MSQ SVR Pile Card
Standard, Drawing or Specification Reference - C0700
Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - Structural Engineer to inspect the reinforcing cages that it comply with the design requirements.
Standard, Drawing or Specification Reference - 3235599-SP03-ST-3151-1 Note 2.4 & 2.7, 3.3, 746-24-874-AC C0601.8

Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - Once the Geotechnical Engineer has accepted the founding conditions, and the Structural Engineer has inspected the reinforcing cage, placement of the cage shall occur as soon as possible.
○ Minimum concrete cover 75mm at any location.
○ Tolerance on Spiral Spacing +10mm for 150mm Spiral.
QA Record - Survey Checks before and after pour. As-Built, Pile Card
Standard, Drawing or Specification Reference - 3235599-SP03-ST-3151-1 Note 1.7

Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - 4 x 40mm ID Integrity testing steel tube shall be installed at equal distance around the inside of the reinforcing cage for the full length of the pile.
QA Record - Photos, Structural Eng. Inspection, As-Built, Pile Card
Standard, Drawing or Specification Reference - 3235599-SP03-ST-3150-1 Consent Inspection Schedule

Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - 2 Days notice to the Design Engineer. Pre-Pour inspection to be completed by DNZ Engineer, Auckland Council Inspector and Design Engineer.
QA Record - MSQA SVR, Pile Card, Building Consent Booklet
Standard, Drawing or Specification Reference - 746-24-874-AC C0601.4.6, C0601.10.4, 3235599-SP03-ST-3151-1 Note 3.6
Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - 40Mpa Concrete.
○ 3 Specimens tested 1 x 7 Days & 2 x 28 Days.
○ Spead test shall be completed on each sample taken from the chute.
○ Column and pile cage to be suspended for a minimum of 8 hours after placement of concrete.
○ Pile concrete is to be over-poured.
QA Record - Concrete Dockets, Compressive Test Results, Slump Test Results, Photos
Standard, Drawing or Specification Reference - 746-24-874-AC C0602.6, 3235599-SP03-ST-3151-1 Note 3.6 NZS 3109

Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - Over-Poured concrete shall be removed carefully without damaging the reinforcing cage to form a Type B Construction Joint at the top of pile.
3.13 - Post-Pour Inspection Cross Hole Sonic Loggging
Standard, Drawing or Specification Reference - 746-24-874-AC C0500.2 A5.0
Construction Activity Description, Test Type and Acceptance Criteria - Testing to be undertaken at 8 days

○ Preliminary results shall be submitted to the Engineer within 1 day of completion of the test results. The Final results and findings shall be submitted to the Engineer within 3 days of completion to the test. Once the Engineer has reviewed the results of the tested piles, and are satisfactory the tubes shall be grouted with a 40Mpa Cementitious grout.
